================ 6ce96224426c3f6e3ee5dbaff00d6c981dce62c2 r1598 trunk/embox
[0.1.9] Good news everyone, static code analisys with Understand helped to fix a lot of wornings, and C99
 conformance. Also this commit fix the embox code style by filter like 's/\r//;s/[ \t]*$//;/^$/N;/\n$/N;//D;s/if(/if (/;s/(\w) ++/\1++/;s#){#) {#;s/for(/for (/;s/while(/while (/;s#){#) {#;s#\*\)(\w)#*) \1/'. Try to follow the code style in your next commits. Attention, don't use above mentioned filter directly without understanding what it doing, that's only example. Night build script said that all templates (except x86) build success.
p.s.: especialy for Dasha: be carefull, scripts broke your russian comments in lcd driver a little bit, I'm sorry.

================ 927eed1f0344f5130476337060f70eb3a8d7d245 r2611 trunk/embox
with vconsole queue work
================ a117d06e0126bd6610b4a8a03e182cea0176cd2c r2618 trunk/embox
С точки зрения бытового перфекционизма предлагается из image.mk убрать -Wdeclaration-after-statement и по мере надобности объявлять переменные непосредственно в блоках, где они используются, а не в начале функции.

Причины:

0. Не кашерно ни разу, удобнее видеть переменные там, где они используются.
1. Это ограничение имеет место быть только в С90, мы же используем С99. В С99 можно по мере надобности объявлять.
2. Хоть старик Бьёрн и не имеет отношения к С, всё же он проповедует, что лучше объявлять по мере надобности.
3. Стив Макконнелл в книге «Совершенный код» категорично пишет: "В идеальном случае сразу объявляйте и определяйте каждую переменную непосредственно перед первым обращением к ней", объявление всех переменных в начале функции — страшное зло.
4. Это усложняет комментирование блока объявления переменных.

Вышесказанное никоим образом не призывает бросаться править существующие обьявления и не вносит смуту в народные массы, просто не запрещает оное действо.

================ 07001162e02b0182397b288a2a4af03055bcd20c r4230 trunk/embox
Ping epopee finish:
icmp.c:
First of all, logic in echo reply was broken - FIX: in reply icmp Type should be ICMP_ECHOREPLY.
It seems that sequence field should stay unaltered (the question persists if skb_copy should copy sequence field also, and why it doesn't).
ping.c:
minor fix -  cnt_resp and cnt_error initialization each time ping is executed. That lead to misinterpretation of results when executed several times. static variable is initialized one time if you don't do it yourself.

================ eaf384944a079e6796cb8e0c8387fcd0c307781f r4494 branches/mybuild
Remove list functions related to old object-oriented structure
================ 06a5c2a082d1d1373b5570f16ba7d902f2a20b11 r4496 branches/mybuild
Major update of object subsystem.
Rework class definition builtins, primarily the way how class attributes are handled and inherited. Add new 'property' member type, add an ability to specify whether a field or property holds a list of values.
Fields are now accessed using get-field/set-field builtins, old get/set now refer to properties. In order to save backward compatibility a special 'property-field' builtin is provided.
================ bee588a3c7b0f800ffd37ab9a054b24cbd9a2239 r4497 branches/mybuild
Update m2make generator template.
Replace getter/setter methods with properties. Proper handling of volatile features. Special case for container references. Exclude abstract types from factory. Add flags initialization to meta model constructor.

[mybuild] runlevel setup
================ 430948282831795286c3b55fb91ee50687e0bbb3 r4577 branches/mybuild
Huge simplification of EModel generated stuff.
Now modeled objects don't use metamodel to perform operations with references. This simplifies bootstrap of the EModel itself and improves performance of model building. Also remove generation of a dedicated class for metamodel, now all meta objects are stored in simple variables, this should speed up script loading a bit too.
This commit does not include regenerated EModel.
================ b9cad8ac9cd42a02b463a49d8923a7a50098e10a r4578 branches/mybuild

Introduce object-level generic mappings, which include:
	$(map name : type) for defining a new mapping in class,
	$(map-get map/key), $(map-set[+|-] map/key,value) for runtime map operations,
	serialization support (rather weak and dirty for now)

Redesign linking-related class hierarchy, now only a single Linker class is used to link so-called resource sets. Also exported objects is now represented by FQN-to-object mapping, which is persisted as well and used to resolve modules listed in configs (fixes Issue 390).

================ 0ecc8d67c99e5f9faac11b7239f0694468fbd9c4 r5450 trunk/embox
Add driver to work with FAT12/FAT16/FAT32

Modify the mkfs command.

mkfs  [ -t type ] file [ blocks ]

mkfs -t vfat /dev/ram1 456

command create ramdisk and format it to FAT16 (by default) file system.

Does not create directories and files yet.

================ f9bafaf544b3b840d0f24f9f1ccc34ba17ea846a r5851 trunk/embox
Rewrite object member access parsing, now it handles chains of property 'get' through '>' sign (not tested yet). Example:
	$(invoke ref->prop1>prop2>method,args...)
It is the same as:
	$(invoke $(get $(get ref->prop1).prop2).method,args...)

================ 10c7e16b86b7b41989a99c89c1983e1804df5288 r11815 trunk/embox
issue 663: fixed
assert(__THREAD_STATE_WAITING & thread->state) removed - timer can try notify thread after it was awoken (placed in runq), but before this thread become current and didn't close timer yet.
assert(t != current) removed - of course thread can wake itself. For example, it's ready for sleeping, but is not sleeping now. IRQ handler wakes it, but thread is current yet. It's normal situation.

================ c4c90015307e043736eb0f868bd96e344acc65c4 r13147 branches/embox-profiling
[profiling] deleting "begin" and "end" fields from struct trace_block

Actually, they are not being used at all. Originally, they were supposed to be used at trace_block_enter and trace_block_leave to calculate time and so on, but it's easier to implement and easier to understand the code when trace_block structure has all required fields by itself (count, time, etc).

================ 2ff525413a523a79496e296b049f0e34d1e05502 r13311 branches/embox-profile
merge from trunk
================ a75258428e1df7c6d4caec0e1dcc5b14fb3f476f r13365 branches/embox-profile
[profile] Deleting itimer from struct trace_block
Traceblock are not consistent if they have different clock_sources.
But if they have one clock source, it does not make much sense to initialize itimer on every trace_block_enter (it worses the performance drammatically).
Now all trace blocks use the same clock source.

================ ebf869266eed9be8cdff76ef31a30417e579b4c9 r13521 branches/embox-profile
[profile] removing another global variable: cyg_profiling; enum profiling_mode implemented.
This variable was a state variable presenting profiling mode (off/manual/auto/etc). To avoid wasting global name space, this variable was removed and replaced with following functions: get_profiling_mode(), set_profiling_mode() which works with corresponding enum datatype.
Corresponding changes in flags.mk are made.

================ 3ec25b602b0e38f354f58152b30a7e0f201abdd6 r14958 trunk/embox
[mybuild-old] distgen

A new target for generating a self-sustained source distribution which can be
built with plain-old Make (without Mybuild bloat).

Example:
$ make distgen-x86/nonvga_debug DIST_DIR=dist
$ make -C dist
